facts.1: Vidovdan is one of the most important Serbian holidays, commemorated on June 28 each year.
facts.2: It marks important historical events for Serbs, including the Battle of Kosovo in 1389.
facts.3: St. Vitus is a Christian saint, and Vidovdan is recognized in his honor, holding both religious and national significance.

facts.1: June 28 marks the anniversary of the Stonewall riots, which began in 1969 at the Stonewall Inn in New York City's Greenwich Village.
facts.2: The event is considered the catalyst for the modern LGBTQ+ rights movement.
facts.3: Pride Month is celebrated in June to honor the Stonewall riots and promote equal justice and opportunity for LGBTQ+ individuals.

facts.1: Constitution Day in Ukraine is celebrated on June 28 to commemorate the adoption of the Constitution of Ukraine in 1996.
facts.2: It is a national holiday that features patriotic concerts, educational events, and exhibitions.
facts.3: The Constitution of Ukraine was the first full codification of the rights and obligations of citizens and all state authorities.
